metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14348 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
libcgroup up to and including 0.41 creates /var/log/cgred with mode 0666regardless of the configured umask, leading to disclosure of information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14348` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgroup-tools - 0.41-10
libcgroup1 - 0.41-10
libpam-cgroup - 0.41-10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcgroup package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.41-10').
